text: White Horse Tavern is a historic inn and tavern located in Douglassville, Amity Township, Berks County, Pennsylvania. The building is situated on the banks of the Schuylkill River. It was originally built in 1765, and is a -story, five-bay, sandstone building with a gable roof. A -story, three-bay, addition was constructed in 1780. The building operated as an inn and tavern until 1870, when it was converted to a three-family residence. The house was obtained in 1971, and subsequently restored by the Historic Preservation Trust of Berks County. Note: This includes It is part of the Morlatton Village historic site. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1975. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Berks County, Pennsylvania ==References== ==External links== * Historic Preservation Trust of Berks County: White Horse Inn Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Pennsylvania Category:Georgian architecture in Pennsylvania Category:Houses completed in 1765 Category:Houses in Berks County, Pennsylvania Category:National Register of Historic Places in Berks County, Pennsylvania
title: White Horse Tavern (Douglassville, Pennsylvania)
